lead_paragraph: Churches have been holding special prayers, revivals and workshops, with the purpose of refastening ties frayed by Ebola, a disease that made many fear those closest to them.

headline.print_headline: Liberia Conquers Ebola, but Faces a Crisis of Faith
headline.main: Liberia Conquers Ebola, but Faces a Crisis of Faith

snippet: Churches have been holding special prayers, revivals and workshops, with the purpose of refastening ties frayed by Ebola, a disease that made many fear those closest to them.
abstract: World Health Organization announces Ebola outbreak has officially ended in Liberia, as at least 42 days have passed since last victim died; country is engaged in task of rebuilding health and educational infrastructure and rehabilitating economy, but churches face challenge of rebuilding their flocks; many lost congregants when church leaders denied that disease was real, or called it a divine punishment.
